people: Currently, there are many new drugs
disguised in many different forms
that are entering schools as
fun drinks to charm dry tongues and are
used by students.  These new types of drugs
can cause immeasurable consequences
and this situation requires
management agencies and schools to
take more drastic measures
recently.
Investigating drug crimes, the Ministry of Public Security has
destroyed a group that self-made a
new type of drug called water fun,
about 750 kg of drugs were exported to the
market and the users were mainly
young people.  By its nature, it
is still a stimulant and it is
very harmful to the user's body,
especially having a strong impact on the
central nervous system as well
as the cardiovascular system.  Students are
very curious about
these new types of drugs, especially electronic cigarettes, which represent something
cool. That's why the
school, teachers and
parents are very worried.  Concerned about
this problem, many local authorities have
increased measures to control
foods sold in front of school gates.
New generation drugs have the ability to cause addiction
very quickly and increase damage to the
central nervous system, making people
Uncontrollable behavior and constant
thinking. Therefore, preventing drugs from attacking
schools needs to be done
regularly and continuously from all three sides, the
school family, the
authorities, and traffic at the end of the year.

Nha Phu lagoon of Ninh Hoa town, Khanh
Hoa province. The tide is very shallow. This has caused
difficulties for residents of a fishing village
specializing in fishing.  Catching mantis shrimp when the boat lands.
However, due to the high resale price of mantis shrimp,
people are quite excited. Ngoc Diem
fishing lane in Ninh commune, at least,
Ninh Hoa commune is a fishing lane specializing in catching
mantis shrimp in Khanh Hoa province because the sea is very
shallow.  exposed many mud flats
hundreds of meters wide, causing people to return after a
night of fishing for mantis shrimp in Nha Phu lagoon
and have to wade through the mud and push each
boat with difficulty to reach the shore. Even though
the sea was shallow, the people still won.  There are quite a
lot of mantis shrimps, a type of seafood that has
high value because it lives in the wild, so the meat
is very sweet and is popular in the market. Currently, the
selling price for salted fish right on the shore is
about 2,000 to 300,000 VND per kg depending
on the average size.  Each person
won a few 3 kg, some people were lucky enough to win nearly
10 kg, which is a quite high source of income for
the people of the fishing village. It is known that mantis shrimp
is a type of seafood that lives a lot in the waters of
Nha Phu lagoon of this fishing village.

law stemming from a conflict between two
students. The father of one student tried to beat the other student, causing him to be
hospitalized as a result of the angry parent.
This character was prosecuted and detained by the police of Tuong Nghia district,
Quang Ngai province on
December 19.
The subject arrested was Phan
Thuong My, 44 years old, in La Ha town,
Tu Nghia district. Previously, MK was a 9th grade student at
Central High School.  My son and I
had a conflict while
studying at school, but
after hearing my son speak again, My tried to beat
MK to warn him not to continue
arguing with his son.  Security camera images
show America using his fists,
elbows, and knees to hit vital positions,
forcing the child to be hospitalized. The
images are being transmitted on social networks, causing
outrage according to MK's medical records.
At Quang Ngai Provincial General Hospital,
this student suffered an intracranial injury and was
transferred to the neurosurgery department for treatment.
His parents said that in addition to the
above injuries, his son
also had a broken tooth that hurts all the time.  It
appears that the American subject has been prosecuted and
detained for intentionally causing injury. The
incident is being investigated further by Tu Nghia district police. The
US has expressed
remorse for his behavior

was a pair of sandals and a baseball cap.
Until 18 hours later, the victim's body was discovered.

Trung Luong My Thuan highway, the section passing through
Chau Thanh district, Tien Giang province, causing
damage to the vehicles.  Fortunately,
there were no casualties in the incident that
occurred on the afternoon of December 19,
according to people who witnessed it at about
3:00 p.m. on December 19 while traveling on the
highway through km 51 heading from
Ho Chi Minh City to the region.  In the West, many
people heard the sound of leather hitting hard. At this time, many people
discovered that the tractor-trailer and the car had
collided in four places. At the scene, the
tractor-trailer was damaged at the front and the
car's front and rear were deformed.  In
addition, a median of the expressway was also
knocked down. Going in the opposite direction, I
received news that the expressway management guard was
promptly present to regulate
traffic and investigate the cause of the

Previously, Quang Nam province police
organized a vehicle inspection and discovered that driver
Nguyen Van B, born in 1997, residing in Quang Nam,
was transporting five N2O laughing gas cylinders for sale to
work.  He
transported Laughing gas from his wife's house in Binh
Trung commune, Than Binh district to sell it and was
discovered to be arrested. B confessed that he
regularly went to sell N2O gas in
Quang Nam province and Da Nang city
to conduct inspections at his wife's house.  B's warehouse and
warehouse, the police department investigating
drug crimes discovered and confiscated 134
metal cylinders of different weights.
Many young people often pump N2O gas into
balloons, also known as laughing balloons, to
use for purposes  entertainment purposes according to the Ministry of Health.
Regular abuse of N2O can
cause memory disorders, sleep disorders, and
use of laughing balloons containing N2O gas, which is

drugs, causing loss of control over ability.  Acts that
